intro: Leandra caquetensis, commonly known as the Caquetá leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
